title: First Step
text: The first step is to set up an equation for the function, for example $$y=4x$$.
speech: The first step is to set up an equation for the function, for example , y is equal to 4 x, .

title: Second Step
text: The second step is to solve the function in terms of $$x$$. For the example in the last hint, $$f(x)=4x$$, this would result in the equation $$x=\frac{y}{4}$$.
speech: The second step is to solve the function in terms of  x . For the example in the last hint,  f of x, is equal to, 4 x , this would result in the equation  x, is equal to y over 4 .

title: Final Step
text: The final step after solving for $$x$$ is to consider $$x$$ the output of the inverse function and the other side of the equation the ouput of the inverse function (after replacing $$y$$ with x.) Forthe example in the previous two hints, the output of the inverse function would thus be $$4x$$, and the input $$x$$. In equation form, $$f^{\left(-1\right)} x=\frac{x}{4}$$.
speech: The final step after solving for  x  is to consider  x  the output of the inverse function and the other side of the equation the ouput of the inverse function (after replacing  y  with x.) Forthe example in the previous two hints, the output of the inverse function would thus be  4 x , and the input  x . In equation form,  f raised to the parentheses negative 1  power x is equal to x over 4 .
